definition: to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: I'd like to speak to someone in the personnel department.
sentences.chinese: 工作安排是这个单位人事处的主要任务。

sentences.english: HR manager and i have appointed to a interview at tomorrow morning.
sentences.chinese: 人事处经理与我约定明天上午面谈。

sentences.english: Job seeks should apply at the personnel office.
sentences.chinese: 寻找工作的人应当亲自到人事处提出申请。

sentences.english: Team of Research Program, Personnel Department, Haikou Central Sub- branch of the People's Bank of China.
sentences.chinese: 中国人民银行海口中心支行人事处课题组。

sentences.english: Party A entrusts the Personnel Department to sign this agreement.
sentences.chinese: 甲方委托甲方人事处代为签订本协议。

sentences.english: BILL: Well, maybe the employment office knows it, too.
sentences.chinese: 年夜略人事处里也知道这个情况。

sentences.english: The company policy asked that he immediately notify either his superior or the human-resources department.
sentences.chinese: 公司要求他马上通知他的上司或者人事处。

definition: Foreign Affairs Office (at a university)/Foreign Affairs Department
temporary assignment to a Chinese government or CCP post
